result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant requesting lower bond/signature bond

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim J.B (person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Henry J Gryer III appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Henry J Gryer III. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
